statement.p: Find the slope of the tangent to the curve x^{2}+6xy+y^{2} = 17 at (1,2).

p.em: (Enter undef if the slope is not defined at this point.)

solution.p: Differentiating with respect to x gives 2 x + 6 y + 6 x y' + 2y y'=0 so that y' = -\frac{2 x + 6 y}{6 x + 2 y}.
At the point (1,2) the slope is - \frac{2\cdot 1+6\cdot 2}{6\cdot 1+2\cdot 2} = -{\textstyle\frac{7}{5}}.
